page.title: 08ST.KEVERNE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: { ST.KEVERNE PARISH COUNCIL The Parish Council meets in the Parish Hall on the first Thursday in the month. It has a chairman, a clerk and a County Council representative. The village policeman, press and public may attend. There are 9 councillors for St. Keverne and 4 for Coverack all of whom live within the parish. They are responsible for lighting, footpath preservation, road maintenance, planning applications, playing fields, charity money from car parks and Parish Room maintenance. They are responsible for the upkeep of the churchyards of St. Keverne and Coverack for which Â£800 is allocated. Â£500 is allocated for the playing fields and sports pavillion and childrens play area. Their overall purpose is to {Maintain and improve {the area}.
